data.enText: the hard central part of a fruit such as an apple, that contains the seeds
the central part of an object
the earth's core
the core of a nuclear reactor

data.chText: 最重要的部分；核心；要点；精髓
data.enText: the most important or central part of sth
the core of the argument

data.chText: 对环境的关注是我们政策的核心。
data.enText: Concern for the environment is at the core of our policies.
a small group of people who take part in a particular activity

data.chText: 他的周围聚集了一帮谋士。
data.enText: He gathered a small core of advisers around him.
to the core
so that the whole of a thing or a person is affected
She was shaken to the core by the news.
He's a politician to the core (= in all his attitudes and actions) .

data.chText: 最重要的；主要的；基本的
data.enText: most important; main or essential

data.chText: 诸如英语和数学等核心科目
data.enText: core subjects (= subjects that all the students have to study) such as English and mathematics
the core curriculum

data.chText: 我们需要集中在核心业务上。
data.enText: We need to concentrate on our core business .

data.chText: 运用新技术是我们策略的关键。
data.enText: The use of new technology is core to our strategy.

data.chText: 核心（ 信念、价值、原则等）
data.enText: the most important or central beliefs, etc. of a person or group

data.chText: 这个党正在逐渐偏离其核心价值观。
data.enText: The party is losing touch with its core values.
used to describe the most important members of a group

data.chText: 这个队是以几名骨干队员为核心构建的。
data.enText: The team is built around a core group of players.

data.chText: 去掉（水果）的果心；去（水果）的核儿
data.enText: to take out the core of a fruit

means: 核心( 信念、价值、原则等)

ex.chText: 会议室中央有一张巨大的橡木桌子。
ex.enText: There is a huge oak table in the centre of the meeting room.

ex.chText: 北京是中国的政治和文化中心。
ex.enText: Beijing is the political and cultural centre of China.

synonyms.bx: 指空间、地域或物体的中心点，也可指学术、商业等活动的中心。

ex.chText: 去除果核，把苹果切成薄片。
ex.enText: Remove the cores, and thinly slice the apples.

ex.chText: 他们吁求的核心是言论自由。
ex.enText: The core of their appeal is freedom of speech.
Debt is at the core of the problem.

synonyms.bx: 指某物体的中心部分或某事物最重要的部分。

ex.chText: 我们必须抓住问题的核心。
ex.enText: We must get to the heart of the issue.

ex.chText: 他们去了市中心的一家大酒店。
ex.enText: They went to a big hotel in the heart/centre of the city.

synonyms.bx: 指事物最重要的部分；也可指方位上的中心，作此义解时可与 centre 换用。

ex.enText: There is a table in the middle of the parlor.
He came back home in the middle of the night.

synonyms.bx: 指空间、时间或事件的中间部分。

ex.chText: 我们在他的一群老朋友中找到了他。
ex.enText: We found him in the midst of a group of his usual friends.

ex.chText: 我在工作中趁隙休息了一个钟头。
ex.enText: In the midst of my work I snatched an hour's rest.

synonyms.bx: 指位于某地的中部或者处于一群人、一堆物品中间，也可指在某事的进行过程中。

ex.chText: 欲吃果仁者，必先破其壳。
ex.enText: He that would eat the kernel must first crack the nut.

ex.chText: 这种果仁面包吃起来又香又甜。
ex.enText: This kind of kernel bread tastes fragrant and sweet.

synonyms.bx: 指坚果、子粒的仁或核，通常较软，可食用。

ex.enText: Don't throw your peach core on the floor!
This pear is rotten to the core.

ex.chText: 他吃苹果太快，差点把核给吞了。
ex.enText: He ate the apple so quickly that he almost swallowed the core.

synonyms.bx: 指某些水果（如梨、苹果等）的核或心，通常较硬，不可食用。

data.enText: to the core
so that the whole of a thing or a person is affected
She was shaken to the core by the news.
He's a politician to the core (= in all his attitudes and actions) .

tr: a bar of magnetic material (as soft iron) that passes through a coil and serves to increase the inductance of the coil
the chamber of a nuclear reactor containing the fissile material where the reaction takes place
(computer science) a tiny ferrite toroid formerly used in a random access memory to store one bit of data
example: each core has three wires passing through it, providing the means to select and detect the contents of each bit

tr: the choicest or most essential or most vital part of some idea or experience
example: the gist of the prosecutor's argument
the heart and soul of the Republican Party

tr: the central meaning or theme of a speech or literary work
a small group of indispensable persons or things
example: five periodicals make up the core of their publishing program
the ball has a titanium core

tr: the central part of the Earth
a cylindrical sample of soil or rock obtained with a hollow drill
remove the core or center from

value.def: The core of a fruit is the central part of it. It contains seeds or pips.

example.ex: Peel the pears and remove the cores.

value.def: If you core a fruit, you remove its core.
value.tran: 去掉…的果心;给（水果）去核

value.def: The core of an object, building, or city is the central part of it.

example.ex: The core of the city is a series of ancient squares.
example.tran: 市中心是一座接一座古老的广场。

value.tran: (物体、建筑物或城市的)中心部分

value.def: The core of something such as a problem or an issue is the part of it that has to be understood or accepted before the whole thing can be understood or dealt with.

example.ex: ...the ability to get straight to the core of a problem...
The notion that blacks comprise a problem is at the core of racist reasoning.
example.tran: 黑人总爱惹事这一观念是种族主义论断的核心。

value.def: A core team or a core group is a group of people who do the main part of a job or piece of work. Other people may also help, but only for limited periods of time.

example.ex: We already have our core team in place...
example.tran: 我们的骨干团队已经就位了。

example.ex: A core of about six staff would continue with the project.
example.tran: 由大约6名职员组成的骨干队伍将继续该项目。

value.def: In a school or college, core subjects are a group of subjects that have to be studied.

example.ex: The core subjects are English, mathematics and science...
example.tran: 基础课是英文、数学和科学。

example.ex: I'm not opposed to a core curriculum in principle, but I think requiring a foreign language is unrealistic.
example.tran: 原则上我不反对设置基础课程，但我认为要求掌握一门外语是不现实的。
包括9个学科的核心课程

value.def: The core businesses or the core activities of a company or organization are their most important ones.

example.ex: The core activities of local authorities were reorganised...
example.tran: 地方政府的主要事务进行了调整。

example.ex: The group plans to concentrate on six core  businesses...
example.tran: 该集团打算主营6种业务。

example.ex: However, the main core of the company performed outstandingly.
example.tran: 然而，该公司的主营业务却表现出色。

value.def: You can use to the core to describe someone who is a very strong supporter of someone or something and will never change their views. For example, you can say that someone is Republican to the core .

example.ex: The villagers are royalist to the core.
example.tran: 那些村民是十足的保皇主义者。

value.def: If someone is shaken to the core or shocked to the core, they are extremely shaken or shocked.

example.ex: Leonard was shaken to the core; he'd never seen or read anything like it.
example.tran: 伦纳德极为震惊;他从未看过或读过这样的东西。

trans: 核心价值观；核心价值；迈格森的使命；核心價值；企业核心价值观
核心课程；核心課程；核心课程、基础课程；核心课程,基础课程

型芯材料；囊心物；核材；芯材；芯材料
